revised_title: Nutritional Biochemistry and Trace Elements in Ruminant Physiology
tldr: The author discusses the work of the Division of Biochemistry and General Nutrition, focusing on their research in ruminant physiology, particularly the nutritional biochemistry of sheep and the effects of trace elements on their health. They discovered that deficiencies in cobalt and copper can cause various diseases in sheep, and that supplementing these elements can improve their health and productivity.
